title: Government Urged To Build The Tourism Industry
text:
Travel & Tourism | 28 September 2015 12:07 CET Government Urged To Build The Tourism Industry By Kofi Oppong Kyekyeku 
As part of activities marking this years World Tourism Day, the CEO of Media For Development Foundation, a human rights and non profit making media advocacy organization in Sunyani, Mr.Emmanuel O.Appiah has called on the government to put in more efforts in building the tourism industry in the country. 
The 2015 World Tourism Day is under the theme: "One Billion Tourists, One Billion Opportunities." 
According to him there are so many benefits in the tourism industry of which if the government is looking at seriously it will generate more in than cocoa and oil. 
The CEO added that there are some challenges in most of the tourist sites in the country which need a serious attention.Some of the challenges he said include, poor road network to most of the sites, lack of proper reception,lack of maintenance among others. 
Mr.Emmanuel O. Appiah disclose this in an interview with news men in Sunyani on the world tourism day. 
According to him there are so many tourist attraction places in the brong ahafo region like Kintampo water falls,Wenchi Nchirah water falls, Boafiama Fiama Monkey among others but people do not visit those places regular because of the challenges. 
He therefore appealed to the Ghana Tourism Authority and for that matter the government to put in effective measures in place that will promote and developed the tourism industry in the country.
